content: kicking this off shortly. looks like we have a few last-minute beta backports to get in, so I'll roll those into the stable-targeted PR after promoting beta.
posted https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72883
@simulacrum did you already send the beta promotion?
@Pietro Albini master to beta and beta to stable are both done, though I'm not sure if beta published
ok we should start with crater then
let me see if beta was published
Needed to cherry pick some rustfmt fixes
nope
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72917
It merged two hours ago
If you want we can kick off beta publishing manually on rcs
yeah that'd be good, this way we don't have any downtime in crater
I would prefer that we do, so that I can take care of master bootstrap update later today as well
(the current run is expected to finish in 15 hours)
Okay, I'll kick rcs in a bit
kicked beta off on rcs

1.45.0-beta.3359

Looks like the beta version is out of control again :laughing:

Jonas Schievink said:

1.45.0-beta.3359

Looks like the beta version is out of control again :laughing:

Reminds me of the days of SVN/P4 derived version numbers :D
I think we're building too early or something, I really don't know
it always gets fixed on the next beta
logic is here if someone wants to investigate: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/627957100c9b810a10c30a11cf1a8a3188d5f9f4/src/bootstrap/lib.rs#L961-L994

@T-release the core team has put together a replacement blog post which I'm planning to post -- https://hackmd.io/_SWOxJLeTbiXtqJmgqzxUQ -- please let me know if you have specific objections. I plan to kick the release off in roughly ~45 minutes, so blog will likely publish in around 1.5-2 hours. We should have looped T-release in earlier, that was an oversight on my part, sorry.
combined with that, we plan to not post links to the post across various social media sites ourselves.
I don't have a specific objection, but you know this is going to inflame the complaints we've already seen about this...
If that's what the core team wants :shrug:

Yes, we are aware :)

I think it's worth doing.
anyway, how is the release itself going? I note there wasn't any announcement of a test build this time, but I assume that's ready to go?

Hm. I understand not posting across social media; but why post a technical summary of the release at all if it's going to be truncated? I think it would be better to do one of:

  • don't publish a blog post at all
  • publish an even shorter blog post, with just the "scale back" and "always political" paragraphs, followed by links to the relnotes and the thanks page
  • publish the original release notes, but with an added note from the core team at the top
I like the last idea, full notes led by a core team declaration

I think having full notes is reasonable because reading them is strictly optional. If someone reads the top paragraphs and thinks "I should be spending time on something non-technical instead", they can do that.
it was already relatively short, "a smaller release", but I think it's still worth highlighting the hard work of contributors, despite current events
Conversely, if the point is not to distract from politics at all, then simply publishing nothing seems preferable.
Well, hence the links to relnotes and thanks
I'm just a rust user, but the proposed notes look fine, just highlighting the main topics. The full changelog is not that long and more detail can be easily found there.
Here's the "even shorter" version: https://hackmd.io/Z3MgExtkQ5G-tn8lwgbBKA
@simulacrum Super supportive of cutting the post short, I think it should mention Black Lives Matter by name in the link text though.

cuviper said:

anyway, how is the release itself going? I note there wasn't any announcement of a test build this time, but I assume that's ready to go?

The release is ready to go. We weren't certain earlier in the week if we wanted to go ahead with it which is why I didn't end up making a test build announcement.

The core team discussed the option of not publishing anything, but there was some push back against that -- in particular @Pietro Albini felt that it would be confusing for users to see nothing at all.
@XAMPPRocky Edits are definitely appreciated wrt to that, I wasn't sure how to integrate the link well.

@BatmanAoD (Kyle Strand) wrt to having the full post but a different header, I think that's an interesting option but realistically the full post didn't have that much more detail than what this has (mostly just more expansive descriptions).
I agree it's better to post something saying there will be nothing, that makes a statement. Saying nothing looks like we just forgot.
I've already voiced my opinion on this elsewhere, but as long as the Core Team signs this I'm not going to stand in the way.
@simulacrum Made edits, have a look.
Looks reasonable to me.
Okay, will kick release off in roughly 20-30 minutes.
kicked rcs
release published, pushing blog
also manually swapped out robots.txt for doc.rust-lang.org which now disallows all 1. URLs from search engines, hopefully bringing the main docs front and center
publishing cargo/crates-io crates
hm actually looks like something odd is going on here, the 1.44 branch has 0.31.0 as the releases crates-io version but crates.io already has 0.32 published. Going to ask on Discord.
As a reminder, please do not post this to twitter/hn/etc as we intentionally want to avoid noise around it to the extent, we, the Rustteam can :)
@simulacrum someone already submitted to /r/rust -- is a users.rlo post ok?
/me hopes rust-specific social media is not "noise" in that respect
I think just users is fine from the team, yeah
I'd prefer to avoid non-Rust specific forums (and reddit is always a bit questionable)

I mean someone will post it if we don't. :slight_smile: I've also reached out the community team and the mods on discord letting them know about the post so they know and can keep an eye out for anything on any of the forums.
I think there is meaningful distinction to us posting it and others doing so. Thanks for reaching out.

Jonas Schievink said:

1.45.0-beta.3359

Looks like the beta version is out of control again :laughing:

I've got a fix: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72993
(for next time, anyway...)
